intro: Deyeuxia dubia, commonly known as the slender flat sedge, is a grass-like plant belonging to the Cyperaceae family. It is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and compact, cylindrical flower clusters. Native to tropical and subtropical regions, it thrives in wetland environments such as marshes and swampy areas. The plant has a robust root system that helps stabilize soil and prevent erosion. Its botanical features make it an important component of aquatic ecosystems.
